problem.markdown: >>Let's say you're writing a matching problem for categorization. Which of the following is impossible to achieve?<< (!) Putting one choice in one category ( ) Putting one choice into several different categories ( ) Putting several choices into the same category ( ) Allowing multiple correct answers (x) Disabling negative points for incorrect matches (@) None of the above [explanation] Learners are awarded +1 point for a correct match, and -1 point for an incorrect match. If this was not true - if there was no way to lose points - then learners could put every choice into every category and get full points regardless of what the correct answers were. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.label: Let's say you're writing a matching problem for categorization. Which of the following is impossible to achieve?

choicegroup.choice: Putting one choice in one category
Putting one choice into several different categories
Putting several choices into the same category
Disabling negative points for incorrect matches

div.p: Learners are awarded +1 point for a correct match, and -1 point for an incorrect match. If this was not true - if there was no way to lose points - then learners could put every choice into every category and get full points regardless of what the correct answers were.
